Contradict fact: The claim contradicts the fact that the Obamas did display a Nativity scene in the White House for Christmas.
Lack enough support: The claim lacks enough support as there is evidence and documentation showing that the Nativity scene was indeed displayed during the Obama administration.
Problematic assumption: The claim assumes that the Nativity scene was cast aside by the Obamas, which is not supported by evidence.
Exist alternative explanation: There is an alternative explanation that the Nativity scene was not cast aside by the Obamas, but rather continued to be displayed throughout their presidency.
Exaggerate: The claim exaggerates the actions of the Obamas by stating that they cast aside the Nativity scene when there is evidence to the contrary.
Understate: There is no evidence of understatement bias in this claim.
Falters at times: The claim falters by not accurately representing the actions of the Obamas regarding the Nativity scene.
